channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Germany's knife attack that claimed 3 lives
item.description: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a knife attack in Solingen, Germany, that killed three people during the city's 650th anniversary festival. The attacker targeted Christians in retaliation for the treatment of Muslims. Authorities conducted raids and arrested a teenager for withholding information. Investigations are ongoing, as the government pledges support to the affected city.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris can crack open an egg in one hand. Internet is impressed
item.description: Kamala Harris has a whole segment under 'Cooking with Kamala' in her YouTube channel and clips from those videos never fail to amaze social media users as Vice President Kamala Harris is readying for the presidential race. Recently, a video of her cracking open an egg in one hand went viral as social media users want to take up this method as a challenge.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trapped, disconnected from reality': Pilot blames 'magic mushrooms' for mid-flight attempt to disable engines
item.description: Joseph Emerson, an off-duty pilot, claimed psychedelic mushrooms led him to attempt engine shutdown on an Alaska Airlines flight. Emerson, grappling with mental distress following a friend's death, tried to pull fire extinguisher handles mid-flight. Crew members subdued him, leading to an emergency landing in Portland.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Teen paralyzed after botched dive in ‘pool squatting’ challenge sues owners: All about viral trend
item.description: An 18-year-old French man, paralyzed from a failed dive during the 'pool squatting' challenge in 2022, is suing the pool's owners for negligence. Claiming the property should have been secure, he seeks damages despite having entered illegally. This incident highlights the growing problem of unauthorized private pool usage in France.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cheryl Hines trolled for Kennedy Jr's Trump endorsement: 'A horrible f***ing person'
item.description: ​​RFK Jr's wife actor Cheryl Hines had to take the bullet for her husband's decision to endorse former president Donald Trump as the social media users trolled her for Kennedy Jr's decision calling her an 'enabler' and a 'horrible f***ing person'. Cheryl issued a statement Friday after her husband announced to suspend his campaign and support Donald Trump. Kennedy Jr acknowledged his wife's message and expressed his gratitude. He wrote that his wife was uncomfortable with the decision but accepted it.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ohio shocker: Woman allegedly kills and eats cat in front of neighbors, arrested
item.description: A 27-year-old woman in Canton, Ohio, was arrested for allegedly killing and consuming a cat in front of her neighbors. The incident led to her being charged with injuring animals and disorderly conduct. Allexis Telia Ferrell's initial bond was set at $100,000 during her arraignment, highlighting the severity of the charges against her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' husband gets 'progressive sex symbol' tag: 'Move over, Ryan Gosling'
item.description: Second Gentleman Douglas Emhoff, the husband of Kamala Harris, has now earned a new moniker as Kamala Harris officially accepted the Democratic presidential nomination in Chicago -- with Doug being the spring in Kamal Harris' every step. Washington Post columnist Catherine Rampell called Doug Emhoff the progressive sex symbol who is secure about his masculinity to prioritize his wife's ambition.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Joe Ando-Hirsh, TikTok trendsetter behind 'best dressed' Ella Emhoff at DNC
item.description: Ella Emhoff, stepdaughter of Vice President Kamala Harris, wore a unique pastel blue dress at the Democratic National Convention. Designed by TikTok star Joe Ando-Hirsh, the dress featured a flower embellishment crocheted by Emhoff herself. This collaboration highlighted Emhoff’s creative talents and emphasized the influence of emerging designers in political settings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​First prisoner swap since Ukraine's offensive: 230 captives freed in Russia-Ukraine exchange
item.description: ​First prisoner swap since Ukraine's offensive: 230 captives freed in Russia-Ukraine exchange​

item.title: What will Elon Musk and RFK Jr get in administration if Trump wins, JD Vance reveals
item.description: A day before RFK Jr endorse Donald Trump, the former president's running mate and Ohio senator JD Vance revealed what role RFK Jr and Elon Musk would get in the Trump administration if he wins. "I would try not to put the cart too much before the horse. Elon is a genius and he will help us a great deal. But first we will have to win," JD Vance said at a podcast.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Andrew Tate’s luxury car fleet seized amid shocking new human trafficking allegations
item.description: Romanian authorities seized luxury vehicles from Andrew Tate amid human trafficking allegations involving Tate and his brother, Tristan. The DIICOT-led operation detained six individuals and confiscated assets, including cars and data devices. Both brothers are accused of serious crimes, including using the 'loverboy' method to coerce victims into producing pornographic content for financial gain.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Harris-Walz camo hats toppled Trump’s MAGA caps to become a viral sensation
item.description: The Harris-Walz campaign spurred enthusiasm with a popular camouflage baseball hat, resulting in massive orders for New Jersey's Unionwear factory. This surge saw workers clocking 60-hour weeks and additional machines purchased. The hat symbolized Harris's resonance with voters, with over 100,000 sold primarily to women. Unionwear's domestic manufacturing contrasts with Trump's foreign-produced merchandise.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Gen Z and Alpha are calling everything 'Ohio'—And it's not a compliment!
item.description: The term 'Ohio' has become a popular catchphrase among Gen Z and Gen Alpha, referring to anything strange or absurd. Originating from long-standing internet jokes about the state, the word now appears frequently on platforms like TikTok. The meme culture around Ohio, which began with viral YouTube videos in 2009, has significantly evolved over time.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: James Carville says 'every family has...whatever' about Kennedy Jr on Bill Maher show
item.description: Democratic strategist James Carville fumbled and struggled to find the appropriate word to describe RFK Jr's support for Donald Trump in the election 2024. The strategist was on Real Time with Bill Maher yesterday after Kennedy Jr announced that he would withdraw his campaign and would support Donald Trump. "Well you know every family has a ... whatever. That guy is not weird. That boy ain't right. Okay? There's nothing wrong in being weird. But that boy is just not right. He just did something wrong," Carville said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fauci tests positive for West Nile Virus, now recovering at home
item.description: Dr Anthony Fauci was hospitalized after testing positive for the West Nile virus and is now recovering at home. He spent six days in the hospital and now is on the way to full recovery. West Nile virus is a mosquito-borne illness causing fever, body ache, diarrhea and rash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy confronts CNN's Van Jones who says 'I will apologize to your wife'. Here's what happened
item.description: Former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy ran into CNN's Van Jones at the DNC and their interaction went viral as Van Jones once called Vivek a demagogue and Vivek on a different program replied to Van with the F-word and it was the first time the two came face to face after the episode. Vivek paid a surprise visit to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago on the final day. He said he was present at the DNC venue for a few hours and was conducting a few interviews.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: First prisoner exchange since Ukraine's offensive in Russia: 230 soldiers return home
item.description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged 115 prisoners each after mediation by the United Arab Emirates, marking the first swap since Ukraine's recent military operations in Russian territory. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy shared images of released soldiers, while the Russian defense ministry detailed the return of servicemen from the Kursk region. Both countries thanked the UAE for facilitating the exchange.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When RFK Jr explained what's wrong with his voice
item.description: Kennedy Jr's voice is affected by spasmodic dysphonia making it always trembling like he is on the verge of tears. This is not the only medical abnormality that he has. In 2010, Kennedy Jr experienced memory loss and mental fogginess which was attributed to a tumor which Kennedy later referred to as a dead parasite in his head. He said a worm got into his head, ate a portion and then died.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: First 10,000 Mpox vaccines finally set to arrive in Africa after long delays
item.description: The first Mpox vaccines were expected to arrive in Africa next week as the virus continued to cause a severe outbreak. Africa faced significant delays in receiving vaccines, raising global health inequality debates. Despite the urgency, African countries struggled with bureaucratic obstacles. The arrival of vaccines brought questions on effective deployment, especially for children.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Greta Thunberg joins protest at Norway gas plant
item.description: Protesters, including activist Greta Thunberg and Extinction Rebellion members, blockaded a gas and oil processing plant in southwest Norway. The blockade involved kayaks, motorboats, and activists on land hindering access to the Karsto plant, operated by Equinor. Despite the protest, Equinor confirmed the plant continued its usual operations as police addressed the situation.
